intro: Christella serra, commonly known as the serrated Christella, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and other ericaceous plants. The plant is characterized by its small, needle-like leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
